data.text: No country has been spared the effects of changing weather patterns but developing countries–and island states, in particular, are facing the brunt of #climatechange while not having contributed to its root causes. More in the latest @imf_podcast 🎧 https://t.co/6JNMYfA25n

Urgent action needed by G20 and other policymakers across the globe: our new research shows that faster access to vaccinations for high-risk populations could potentially save more than half a million lives in the next six months alone. https://t.co/jQ4qNUUAbz #IMFBlog https://t.co/mRazHyiqGF

The Executive Board agrees to $650 bln SDR allocation, the largest in the IMF’s history. Managing Director @KGeorgieva says it’s a shot in the arm for the world. Next step➡️ the proposal goes to the Board of Governors for approval. Read more: https://t.co/r67sXTQKaC https://t.co/azgmBhhRQT

In today's #WeekendRead: why a two-track recovery from the crisis is bad for the world, a new allocation of IMF Special Drawing Rights, a worrying trend for Africa, the importance of infrastructure development, military spending in the post-pandemic era... https://t.co/nj9B608Czv https://t.co/YalbnlYDCo

IMF Executive Board agrees to$650 bln SDR allocation. @KGeorgieva says it’s a shot in the arm for the world. After the Board of Governors approval, countries will work on options to voluntarily channel SDRs from wealthier countries to more vulnerable ones. https://t.co/r67sXTQKaC https://t.co/UNR7L8WVmn

The Executive Board agrees to $650 bln SDR allocation, the largest in the IMF’s history. Managing Director @KGeorgieva says it’s a shot in the arm for the world. Next step➡️ the proposal goes to the Board of Governors for approval. Read more: https://t.co/r67sXTQKaC https://t.co/HhxuZoYJV5

The upcoming #G20 meeting is an opportunity to advance the plan for a new Resilience and Sustainability Trust. It would support vulnerable countries ravaged by the pandemic, and help them with vital structural transformations. @KGeorgieva #IMFBlog https://t.co/jQ4qNUUAbz

The IMF welcomes the growing role of women in the #Saudi economy as well as changes that allow expatriate workers to move between jobs more easily. The continued increase of women’s participation in the economy will boost productivity, growth, and household incomes. https://t.co/SzHT78YOKg

#SaudiArabia should withdraw its remaining COVID-related economic policy measures gradually to support the ongoing recovery. The IMF recommends spending more in 2021 on transfers to low-income households to boost their incomes and consumption. https://t.co/cwoPudpmGu https://t.co/TDN8PVeBTq

🇸🇦 Along with the reforms it implemented before the #COVID crisis, #SaudiArabia’s quick and decisive response to the pandemic helped soften the impact on people & firms. An economic recovery is underway and is expected to continue. Read our latest report:  https://t.co/mCQh0g9Cjv https://t.co/rfxgFiWuP5
